column4: Is a firewall (software) needed in Ubuntu? Do you guys run one?
Linux is very secure.  I recommend running a firewall if you are hosting a Linux-based router.  but for individual machines, it's not necessary.
I have a router, but it just has the Linksys software on it
my router is a Pentium 133 running Debian (Ubuntu didn't exist when I deployed it :) ).  I run firewalling on it, to prevent some traffic from getting to Windows clients.
